meanings.definition: To officially recognize or approve again
meanings.sent1: The school board will reaccredit the university after reviewing its programs.
meanings.sent2: The committee decided to reaccredit the hospital for another five years.
meanings.sent3: The museum reaccredits the art exhibit, ensuring visitors of its quality.
meanings.sent4: After the renovation, the historic building was reaccredited as a national landmark.
meanings.sent5: The chef's restaurant was reaccredited with a Michelin star, signifying excellence.

meanings.definition: To confirm the accreditation of again
meanings.sent1: The agency will reaccredit the online course to ensure its quality standards.
meanings.sent2: The board decided to reaccredit the program due to its outstanding performance.
meanings.sent3: The zoo reaccredits the conservation project, highlighting its success in protecting wildlife.
meanings.sent4: The organization reaccredited the training program, recognizing its impact on participants.
meanings.sent5: The university was reaccredited for its commitment to academic excellence and student success.
